div.l: And forth with wehe þorourgh þyk air thinne
This Milleward goth a gayn no word he seyde
But doth his note and with þe clerkys pleyed
Til þat hir corn̄ was feire and wel y grounde
And when þe mele was sakked and y bounde
Þis Iohn goth oute and fyndeth his hors awey
And gan to crye harrow and welawey
Oure hors is lost aleyn for goddes banys
Step on þi fete com on man al attanys
Allas oure wardeyn hath his palfrey lorn̄
Þis aleyn al forgate boþ mele and corn̄
Al was oute of his mynde his housbandrye
What which wey is he gon he gan to crye
Þe wif came lepyng Inward with a ren
She seid allas youre hors goth toward þe fen̄
With wilde mares as fast as he gan go
Vnthonk come on his honde þat bound him so
And he þat better shulde have knytte þe reygne
Allas qduod Iohn alleyn̄ for cristes peyne
Ley doun þi swerd and I wol myn alsoo
I am as wight god wote as eny roo
By goddes hert he schal not skape vs both
Whi neddestow pit þe capel in þe lothe
Il hayle by god aleȳn þou is a fonne
Þis sely clerkys han ful fast y ronne
Toward þe fen boþe Alen an eke Iohn
And when þe Miller sigh þei were gon
He halfe a busshel of her floure hath take
And bade his wyfe go knede in a Cake
He seid y trow þe clerkys were aferde
Yet kan a Miller make a clerkys berde
For al her hart yet let hem gon her wey
Lo where þey goth ye lat þe children pley
Þey gete him noȝt so lyȝtly by my crowne
Þis sely clerkis rennen vp and downe
With kepe kepe stand stand Iossa warderere
Go whistle þou and I shal kepe him here
But shortly til þat it was verray nyght
Þey koude not þogh þei dede al hir myght
Her Capel cacche he ran al wey so fast
